title: vaidas.digital frontend
description:
The **frontend** is developed with **React**, creating a responsive and interactive user experience. Some of the key features include:
- **Component-based architecture**: React’s modular approach allows for clean, reusable code and faster development cycles.
- **Responsive design**: The site adapts seamlessly to different screen sizes and devices, ensuring an optimal experience across desktop, tablet, and mobile.
- **Smooth navigation**: The focus is on user-friendly, visually appealing navigation, making it easy for visitors to explore my work, photography, and blog posts.
- **Interactive gallery**: A dedicated photography section is included to showcase my work and tell visual stories.
  
By combining **React** with a **Spring Boot backend**, the website provides a smooth integration between the **CMS** and **frontend**, allowing content to be easily updated and managed.
 

 ---

#### **Next Steps for Frontend**
- **i18n support**: Adding languages like Dutch and Lithuanian.
- **Refactoring to support more dynamic content from backend**

title: vaidas.digital CMS backend
description:
The **backend** of the website is being built using **Java** and **Spring Boot**. It acts as a **CMS (Content Management System)**, allowing easy management of content such as projects, photography, and blog posts. Key components include:
- **Content management** for dynamic updates to project details, portfolio images, and blog content.
- **Database integration** using **MySQL** for storing information about projects, photography galleries, and more.
- **AWS** for storing static content, and perhaps part of secrets - in combo with **Hashicorp**.
- **APIs** that serve project details and photography content to the frontend.

 ---

#### **Next Steps for Backend**
- **Full implementation**
- **Enhance CMS capabilities**: Adding more flexible content management options, including media uploads and rich text formatting.
- **Improve API functionality**: Expanding the API to support more dynamic content retrieval and filtering.
- **Optimize performance**: Fine-tuning database queries and implementing caching strategies to improve load times.

title: Online TV (TOD) Backend
description:
In this project, I was part of the Experimentation Team for a TV on-demand platform, where we worked on enhancing user engagement through feature flags. Our goal was to improve the user experience by testing different features and measuring their impact.

We would take a working **microservice** and create a **feature flag** (using **Java** and **Spring Boot**), which was then applied to a selected group of viewers using **Optimizely**. These viewers (bucketed into different groups) would interact with the new feature, and we’d track metrics like **view events** to see if the feature led to an increase or decrease in engagement.

My role in the team included:
- Writing **code** to implement new features and changes.
- Performing **peer code reviews** to maintain high-quality code.
- Writing **tests** to ensure stability and reliability of the features.
- **Deploying** the code to the cloud using **Jenkins, AWS,** and **Apigee** to make sure everything ran smoothly and efficiently.

title: Telecomunications Offers Fullstack
description:
In this short-term project, we worked with a **mobile telecommunications company** to help them increase sales across various channels—**telemarketing**, **customer service centers**, **emails**, and **SMS messages**. Our goal was to track and calculate the impact of these efforts on sales growth.

We developed a **pilot module** that proposed the **best offers** for each customer based on their **purchase history**, including details on **discounts**, **offers**, and other promotions. This module was designed to be easily customizable by the client to tailor it to their specific needs.

**Key technologies used:**
- **Backend**: Java, **Spring Boot**, **jBPM**, **JPA** (with **MySQL**)  
- **Frontend**: **Thymeleaf** (for module UI) and **Angular** (to integrate the module into the existing system)

**My contributions included:**
- Developing the **backend** in Java, working with **JPA** and **MySQL** to manage and store data.
- Working on the **frontend** using **Thymeleaf** for module UI and making necessary **Angular** code adjustments for integration with the existing environment.
